thread.title: Man Utd’s bench was something out of FIFA 17
thread.title_full: Man Utd’s bench was something out of FIFA 17

title: Man Utd’s bench was something out of FIFA 17
text:
FA Cup Extra Time: United’s $311m bench, Jose’s unexpected reaction to Rovers goal, mind games begin  20am by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS WHY Manchester United’s bench was something out of FIFA 17, Jose Mourinho’s unexpected reaction to Blackburn’s goal, and the mind games with Chelsea have already begun. 
It’s all in a fifth round edition of FA Cup Extra Time! 
UNITED’S SUPERSTAR BENCH ALREADY SEEN IN FIFA 
Manchester United named the most expensive bench ever for their clash with Blackburn. 
Seven players with a combined value of £192 million ($311m) started the fifth round tie as substitutes. 
Among them was Paul Pogba (£89m), Juan Mata (£37m), Eric Bailly (£30m), Luke Shaw (£30m), Bastian Schweinsteiger (£6m), Zlatan Ibrahimovic (free), and academy product Dean Henderson (free). Manchester United's bench = $311 million Source: Twitter 
But for players of FIFA 17, it probably wasn’t the first time they’d seen Ibrahimovic and Pogba warming the bench together. 
The first game you play in the new ‘The Journey’ mode sees Alex Hunter (the virtual player the user controls) take his spot next to Ibrahimovic and Pogba on United’s bench before being substituted on to try and make an impact. 
Against Blackburn it was a slightly different story. Both Ibrahimovic and Pogba came on to combine for a superb matchwinning goal to send the Red Devils through to the quarterfinals where they will meet Chelsea. Alex Hunter next to Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Paul Pogba Source: FOX SPORTS 
STAT PROVES IMPORTANCE OF POGBA-ZLATAN RELATIONSHIP 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic now has 24 goals for Manchester United this season, which is the tied most (with Anthony Martial) of any Red Devil since the start of last season. 
However, his tally wouldn’t be quite so high without Pogba, who’s five United assists have all been for Ibrahimovic. 5 - All five of Paul Pogba's assists for Manchester United in 2016/17 have been for Zlatan Ibrahimovic. Telepathy. — OptaJoe (@OptaJoe) February 19, 2017 
JOSE WAS VERY IMPRESSED BY BLACKBURN’S OPENER 
United eventually triumphed 2-1 over Blackburn, but after 15 minutes it seemed the game could pan out very differently. 
Rovers broke the deadlock when Marvin Emnes played a perfect through ball for Danny Graham to run onto and thump past Sergio Romero into the far corner. 
It had the Blackburn supporters on their feet, but Jose Mourinho was equally as impressed. He was captured on camera nodding and applauding Graham’s effort. 
Mourinho was right to keep a cool head as 10 minutes later Marcus Rashford levelled the scoreline when he was played in by Henrikh Mkhitaryan. Jose applauds opposition goal 0:40 
THE JOSE-CHELSEA MIND GAMES HAVE ALREADY STARTED 
Speaking after the match, Mourinho didn’t take long to comment on the looming quarterfinal against his former team Chelsea. 
His main point was that while United have a piling up of fixtures to play, the Blues basically only have the FA Cup to focus on due to only being involved in the Premier League, which he thinks “they are champions” already. 
“I have to play Saint-Etienne, I have to play the EFL Cup final, I have to play hopefully another opponent in the Europa League,” said Mourinho. 
“I have to fight for a top-four position in the Premier League. I have so many things to think about. 'Impossible to do better' 0:38 
“Chelsea can only think about that [the FA Cup] because they are champions and they have nothing else to fight for. 
“The match is in one month’s time, so I don’t want to think about it. 
“We’re going to fight for the FA Cup, but the League Cup is the one we have a 50 per cent possibility to win. 
“And the next one is to get a result against St Etienne on Wednesday and be in the last 16 of the Europa League.” 
But history is on the side of Mourinho’s team. United have won seven out of nine of their last FA Cup matches against the Blues. 
Don’t choke Chelsea! 7 - Manchester United have won seven of their last nine FA Cup ties v Chelsea, but have lost the last two (2007 Final, R6 in 2013). History. — OptaJoe (@OptaJoe) February 19, 2017 
CESC CELEBRATES MILESTONE, TERRY’S NICKNAME 
Cesc Fabregas has struggled for gametime this season, but in the 2-0 win over Wolverhampton Wolves , he made his 100th Chelsea start and was impressive in a full 90 minutes. 
After the match, he celebrated the occasion with an Instagram post, where John Terry revealed a nickname for the Spaniard with his comment: #SatNav. A post shared by Cesc Fàbregas (@cescf4bregas) on Feb 18, 2017 at 2:30pm PST Report: Wolves get Cup Blues 1:28 
DIEGO COSTA AND WILLIAN’S PUNISHMENT FOR KENEDY 
Against Wolves, Costa scored his first goal in 400 minutes, while Willian had set up Pedro for Chelsea’s opener in the 65th minute. 
But the fun didn’t end their for the Blues’ stars. 
After the game, Willian posted some amusing videos on Instagram featuring Costa and also Kenedy. 
The young Brazilian, who was an unused substitute against Wolves, must have lost some sort of bet because he was subjected to this punishment from the Chelsea duo. A post shared by 101 Great Goals (@101greatgoals) on Feb 18, 2017 at 11:19pm PST 
IF ARSENAL LOSE... 
Lincoln City completed an incredible win over Burnley to become the first non-league side to make the final eight since QPR in 1914. 
Now they will be hoping Arsenal slip up in their clash with non-league outfit Sutton. 
The FA Cup quarterfinal draw revealed Lincoln will face the winner of the Gunners and Sutton. Massive upset in the FA Cup 0:38 
SUTTON BOSS PREDICTS HAMMERING 
However, Sutton boss Paul Doswell is worried his side could be swept aside by Arsene Wenger’s if he plays a full strength team. 
Doswell said: “If he plays the team that beat Southampton 5-0 in the last round, then that would hammer us. 
“I think if you see Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez on the team sheet, our chance doesn’t come beyond nought. 
“But, if they put another team out, then it does get up to the ones and two per cents. 
“Our only chance is if he puts out an Under-23 reserve side out because National League sides can compete against academy players. Then we would have a real chance. 
“If we were to get a draw and we could get back to the Emirates Stadium it would be one of the biggest results in the cup’s history and for the players. 
“The best result for the players would be a 0-0. 
“I think half of my team support Arsenal, so the chance for them to go to the Emirates and just have a great day out would be their preferred result.”
